Package com.jimmyselectronics.disenchantment

Class TouchScreen

java.lang.Object
com.jimmyselectronics.AbstractDevice<TouchScreenListener>
com.jimmyselectronics.disenchantment.TouchScreen
public final class TouchScreen extends AbstractDevice<TouchScreenListener>
A device for display and customer input. It displays a JFrame object to which the graphical user interface may be deployed. Touch screens announce no events. To listen to events there, one has to listen to events from individual graphical objects.
Author:
Jimmy's Electronics LLP

  • Constructor Details

    • TouchScreen

      public TouchScreen()
      Creates a touch screen. The frame herein will initially be invisible.

  • Method Details

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Gets the JFrame object that should be in fullscreen mode for the touch screen. The frame will be invisible until it is explicitly made visible, by calling setVisible(boolean) with a true argument.
      Returns:
      The frame on which the graphical user interface can be deployed.

    • setVisible

      public void setVisible(boolean visibility)
      Allows the visibility of the JFrame to be changed. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      visibility - True if the frame should be made visible; otherwise, false.
